title: message service.copy message is not a function
content: Saved all my email messages from my old Office 365 to a local folder as we were migrating to a new Office 365 account. Now I have the new Office 365 email configured and working fine and I am trying to restore the messages from the local folder back online. When I try to copy them nothing happens but on the program bar at the bottom left it says "message service.copy message is not a function" Searched around seems like no one has this problem. Cannot find anything on how to solve it and copy back my messages to my inbox. Can someone help me sort this? Thank you

creator: sharlsp

title: Failing to open after reinstall on Windows 10
content:
Had some issues with my laptop that resulted in needing to re-install Thunderbird.

I have the data folder for my profile so I thought it would be quick and easy.

However, if installing with the "STart with last profile=1" setting, it does not open. There is no error message on clicking the app. Just nothing happens.

If I change this setting and ensure the parent.lock file is deleted, and then select this profile, same thing happens.

However, if I instead choose to create a new profile, I get the following error:

Profile couldn’t be created. Probably the chosen folder isn’t writable. [Exception... "Component returned failure code: 0x80520012 (NS_ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND) [nsIToolkitProfileService.createProfile]" nsresult: "0x80520012 (NS_ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND)" location: "JS frame :: chrome://mozapps/content/profile/createProfileWizard.js :: onFinish :: line 236" data: no]

I realise this suggest a permissions issue. However, I have made sure that my user and, indeed, any administrators, have full modification access on the user\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird folder and sub-folders. I realise it may not be in these folders but the error message is giving me no clues. Is there any means of debugging this? I have attempted several uninstalls, reinstalls etc and there is no change.
creator: mark.wingfield

title: Changing direction of text
content: Hi, I am using Thunderbird on the Mac. I write most of my emails in English but sometimes I need to send an email in Hebrew. How do I change the direction of the text from left-to-right to right-to-left? At present, the only way I can do this is type my Hebrew text in Word and then cut and paste it into Thunderbird; but that is awkward. Kindly advise how to proceed. Thank you I
creator: igalmoria

title: Thunderbird suddenly will not download mail from the server
content: This problem began suddenly yesterday. Thunderbird is set to download messages automatically. When I opened it up yesterday, 8/27/2023, it said "downloading 1 of 50". I waited and it just stopped, no error message and no mail came in. Repeated attempts resulted in the same outcome. I reset TB, reset the PC with the same result. I turned the computer off overnight hoping for a better tomorrow and the same thing is happening now, except that it says "downloading 1 of 193". The last e-mail messages appear to have been downloaded on 8/26/2023, in the afternoon. No settings were changed prior to this problem popping up. I don't know whether TB did some sort of automatic update and I'm not sure how I would discover that anyway. An outgoing test message from this account to another account did arrive, although slowly. I'm running TB 102.14.0 (32-bit) on an up-to-date Windows 10. Does this problem sound familiar, and is there a simple fix? The mail is on the server and on my phone as well. I use POP and have not had any problems receiving mail on both my iPhone and my PC. Thanks.
creator: CWTL

title: Deleting some messages under Unified View deletes all messages in that account.
content: Hi. Setting up a new installation of Thunderbird for three separate email accounts. On one account, Thunderbird imported over a thousand emails from the Inbox of its Web-based email account directly from that server. Once they all downloaded I highlighted all those that were more than a couple of months old and deleted them. The trouble is that the newer ones got deleted as well. Those newer messages do show up in Inboxes for the individual account, and in the account-specific Inbox under Unified Folders as well, but they are no longer in the main (unified) Inbox. What did I do wrong and is there a way to copy them into the 'catch-all' (unified) Inbox? Thanks in advance.

title: Moving emails from "Inbox" or "Sent" to other subfolders ~ does not work
content: For the past couple of weeks, when I attempt to move an email message from my "Inbox," to another subfolder under "Local Folders," the message moves initially to the created subfolder. But then when I go back to "Inbox," the message I initially removes appears there again. This also happens with the "Sent" category. When I attempt to move a message from "Sent" emails to a subfolder under "Local Folders," the email moves initially, but then a few seconds later, it still shows as remaining in the "Sent" folder, as if I'd never moved it from one area to another. I have logged off and logged back in, restarted, .... no change. It did not used to happen!! Has only been the past couple of weeks that the problem has been going on. Any suggestions, anyone? Thanks.

title: Strange “Duplicate Messages” Problem
content:
I keep seeing duplicate messages show up in my Thunderbird Inbox. These all seem to be older messages, sometimes months old. Some are marked as Read, others Unread. Sometimes the messages will be duplicated more than once. Today I found a number of messages that appear 3 times each.

When I log on to the mail server, there are no messages in the Inbox, so I don't think these are actually being downloaded more than once.

I have the “keep messages on the server” and “until I detete” options checked. My accounts are POP3. This has happened with more than one provider (Zoho, Comcast). I’ve tried deleting the popstate and global-messages files.

Where could these duplicates be coming from?
creator: TheWeaz

title: English spell check dictionary very incomplete
content:
I'm perplexed by the incompleteness of the default English dictionary that ships with Thunderbird (I'm US if that matters).

The latest example from today was that I typed the word "situationally" in an email that I was composing and the default spell check dictionary apparently doesn't recognize that as an actual word and flags it.

I assure you, it is most definitely a word.

It seems to be a problem often with conjugated words like the *ally version of a word, for example.

Unfortunately I cannot think of any other specific examples off the top of my head, but rest assured, this has come up many times for me, I just finally decided to question it today.

Can anyone explain why the dictionary this thing ships with is so woefully incomplete?

Thanks!
creator: digit6

title: How to Subscribe to the other folders from Hotmail account with POP3, in Thunderbird?

Recently, due to very large MBOX file in Thunderbird and slowness in search, I deleted my profile entirely, I went to Hotmail's webmail (OWA) and I created 2 subfolders:

Now, I want to connect again my Hotmail account to Thunderbird, with POP3 again, and to Subscribe also to these new folders (to be able to have them locally).

I am connecting with POP3 but I am not able to see these folders.

Why?

How can I Subscribe/Download them?

I do not want to use IMAP.

Thank you.

title: How to stop thunderbird from downloading every email that I have from my gmail account on the first setup?
content:
So here are my system specifications -

  1. Hardware - Lenovo ThinkPad T14 Gen 3
  2. Firmware version - R23ET65W (1.35 )
  3. Memory (RAM) - 32.0 GiB (DDR5 6400Mhz)
  4. Processor - AMD Ryzen™ 7 PRO 6850U with Radeon™ Graphics × 16
  5. Disk capacity - 256.1 GB (I don't remember the I/O rate right now but as far as I remember it's sufficiently modern)
  6. OS - Fedora Linux 38.20230828.0 (Silverblue)
  7. GNOME version - Fedora Linux 38.20230828.0 (Silverblue)
  8. Window System - Wayland
  9. Kernel - Linux 6.4.12-200.fc38.x86_64

These are like the basic config of my laptop.

Question - How to stop Thunderbird from downloading every email that I have from my gmail account on the first setup?

Concern - Last time I synced, it might have messed up even my boot loader (which should not be possible. Not I am not blaming Thunderbird here, but the timing was uncanny.) and I had to completely wipe the drive and start from scratch. Back then I did not have any data on my drive so it wasn't a big deal. But I don't want to take any chances this time.

Since Thunderbird supernova has a completely different UI, I would like to know if there's any way to disable the downloading of the whole mail box locally. Or am I going to get a prompt asking me specifically for that after logging in into my Gmail account from Thunderbird?

Note - I do not want to mess with about:config at all. And I have looked for a solution but all the answers are at least 3 to 4 years old.
creator: suraj260596

title: TB Calendar, Mac: any way to "cache" events and tasks?
content:
Hi,

Posted this a while ago at http://forums.mozillazine.org, but no response at all. Trying here.

Using TB 115.0.1 (64-bit) on a Mac with High Sierra (MacOS 10.13.6).

Googles security requirements no longer accept e.g. sync with default calendar in my version of the OS. So I use TB:s calendar.

However, one thing bugs me a lot and I have tried all settings to remedy this.

Each time I launch TB, the calendar is completely blank and it starta downloading from Google. I have several different calendars in my Google account, each with quite a few events. It takes several minutes to complete the download and obviously, I need to be online to be able to see coming events.

My question:

Is there any way to make TB cache all events and simply check with Google calendar and update when needed? Exactly as with my emails. Or is it just me who haven't figured it out?

Cheers! Dan
creator: dan279

title: Upgrade to Thunderbird 115 - folder display problem

creator: marchmont

title: Mail from specific forwarded domain not arriving in Thunderbird
content:
I have 2 business-related domains for which I have set-up identical forward rules at my provider. They both forward to the same private email address. I retrieve all my mail in Thunderbird for this private address/domain, so in that way I can handle mail for my private email domain as well as the 2 business-related domains using one mailbox in Thunderbird. This has worked wonderful for years.

Problem is, since a few weeks, only the mails for 1 of the 2 business domains is arriving at Thunderbird correctly. I have already checked with my provider, and they have confirmed that the 2 forwards for those domains are identical, and should work as I expect them. When I look in the webmail for both domains, I can see test messages arriving there. So the webmail works, even for the problematic domain. I have not changed anything related to the mail settings in Thunderbird since more than a year. I am using the most up to date version of Thunderbird (on Windows 11).

I checked for Thunderbird logs, and the only log I could find is a debug.log, and that is empty. I also disabled all Thunderbird filter rules, just to be sure that they weren't the culprit, but still the messages do not arrive. I also checked the junk folder of Thunderbird, and they are not there.

How can I find out why none of the mails for 1 business domain are not arriving in Thunderbird?
creator: bjorn25

title: mail list size and spam
content:
I have a series of questions regarding Thunderbird 102.14.0 For several years I have been unable to send to a mailing list of aprox 50 people and was told it was too many people. I overcame this problem by sending the email to 10 ten different people 5 times. This has worked since then but recently some of those emails have been going straight to the recipient's spam

I want to be able to send one email to every one of my mailing list and also want to prevent it from being recognized as spam
creator: barryd1

title: Cannot open or save large PDF attachment in incoming email
content: I received an email with a large (> 20MB) PDF attachment. I'm using an IMAP server with no local copies of email on the client that's running Thunderbird. The email's body opened OK. I tried to open the PDF attachment and just saw a few garbage characters. I tried to save the PDF attachment to local disk and resulting PDF file is binary containing exactly 27 bytes! Same problem occurs on Linux and Windows( 10 and 11) installs of Thunderbird 102.14.0 (64 bit). The incoming email itself is NOT corrupted: I was able to use Thunderbird to save the whole email to local disk as a .eml file and then open that saved copy in Thunderbird and access the PDF attachment. The problem is not with the IMAP server: I copied the email to a postfix server, to gmail, to yahoo.com and to a Microsoft server, all with the same issue. This problem happens only when the incoming email has very large attachments - smaller attachments of the same type can be saved or opened with no problem.
creator: subelman
